text: U.S. Route 77 (US 77) is a major north-south United States highway. It goes for 1305 miles in the central United States. As of 2005, the highway's northern endpoint is in Sioux City, Iowa, at an interchange with Interstate 29. Its southern endpoint is in Brownsville, Texas, at Veteran's International Bridge on the U.S.-Mexico border. The road does not have signs in and around Dallas, Texas. The route has major freeway parts in Oklahoma City. It includes the Broadway Extension part, which connects suburban Edmond to downtown Oklahoma City. ==Route description== ===Kansas=== US-77 goes for in Kansas. It is a Blue Star Memorial Highway between the U.S. 40 junction and the Cowley County line. In Cowley County, it is called the Robert B. Docking Memorial Highway. Near Arkansas City, it is called the Walnut Valley Greenway.Kennedy, Richie. Kansas Highways Routelog . Route56. URL accessed March 6, 2007. From Nebraska to U.S. 24 and from K-15 to Arkansas City, it is part of the National Highway System. ==References== ==Other websites== * Endpoints of U.S. Highway 77 * Kansas Highway Maps: Current , Historic , KDOT Category:U.S. Highways
title: U.S. Route 77
